data.title: Lame attempt at a yogurt shop
data.text: A third the yogurt offerings of a normal yogurt shop.  Decent assortment of toppings if you can find a spoon.  Had to chase down some in the chocolate shop next door to ring me up. Never again, others do this right.

data.title: Less than mediocre
data.text: Indy Swirl is definitely my least favorite frozen yogurt shop in the city. The toppings are stale and soggy, and the yogurt flavors are nothing compared to the nearby Pearings. I would suggest going elsewhere.

data.title: Best frozen yogurt I've ever had
data.text:
We stumbled upon Indy Swirl, which is connected to the South Bend Chocolate Company on Monument Circle in downtown Indy, last Sunday morning. As I took a sample taste, I noted that it tasted MUCH creamier and more like ice cream than other chain frozen yogurts I'd had. The gentleman there said that many other frozen yogurts weren't real yogurt at all, but Indy Swirl makes their frozen yogurt with the best ingredients- it's REAL frozen yogurt. I believe it!  They have an excellent toppings bar which includes things like real red velvet cake pieces, South Bend candies, pieces of waffle cones, wonderful nuts, and all the usual toppings. The price was comparable to other frozen yogurt places but with a much better product.
You can either sit inside or outside and watch the happenings on the Circle. They also sell a wide selection of specialty bottled beverages like Triple XXX Root Beer (from Triple XXX in West Lafayette), Cheerwine, and much more. We bought a little carton of those to take home for a special occasion.
